utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why do I always have to carry the heavy stuff?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, it’s very simple. In our ragtag band of scientists with nothing to lose, I’m the smart one, Wolowitz is the funny one, and Koothrappali is the lovable foreigner who struggles to understand our ways and fails. That leaves you, by default, as the muscle.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: One more floor, and I’d be the pulled muscle.

utterance.speaker: Penny (who is inside the apartment)
utterance.content: Oh, it’s about time, I’m starving.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, well, we didn’t actually get Chinese food.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Don’t panic, this is better.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, no, you didn’t trade the food for magic beans, did you?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Of course not. And, technically, magic beans would be food, although eating them would be quite a waste, since you could plant them and overnight have a giant beanstalk, which would provide enough roughage for a small city.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, sometimes I don’t listen, sometimes I just watch your jaw go up and down.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: We were on our way to the Chinese restaurant when we thought we saw Adam West, so we followed him.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Who’s Adam West?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Who’s Adam West? Leonard, what do the two of you talk about after the coitus?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: My guess is, “Hey, four minutes! New record!” That’s why I’m the funny one.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Anyway, we followed the guy to this garage sale, and they had the coolest stuff.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: They were closing up. We got this whole box for sixty bucks.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: We didn’t even get to go through it all. There could be anything in here.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: There a new girlfriend in there? ‘Cause you might need one.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No. But there is an original final draft Ghostbusters script with actual slime stains! Oh, you’re right, it’s Ghostbusters 2. Never mind.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, my God. An Alf doll. When I was 11 my mother got me one to help me sleep after my dad left. I used to pretend that my dad had moved to the planet Melmac, and Alf was going to bring him back to me. But he never did. Where’s my daddy, puppet? Where is he?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: That is so sad.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, what’s sad is that you don’t know Adam West was TV’s Batman.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Here’s Spock’s head with no body. Here’s Mr. T’s body with no head. Oh, yeah, here’s Spock’s body with Mr. T’s head. I pity the fool who’s illogical.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, I’m just gonna go home and make a grilled cheese and window-shop on eHarmony.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, bye.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Ooh, look, an Indiana Jones connect-the-dots.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: And an Aquaman action figure.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Looks like someone drew a penis on him.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Huh? That’ll come off.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You see what you’re doing? Stop that.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Fascinating.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It appears to be a Lord of the Rings ring.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It’s even got the Elvish engraving on it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s not Elvish. It’s the language of Mordor written in Elvish script. One Ring to

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: One Ring to find them.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: One Ring to bring them all.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: And in the darkness bind them.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Holy crap, are we nerdy.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: So, I was doing some checking on the ring.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hold on. Sheldon, is there ketchup on that table?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, there is. Oh, here’s a fun fact, ketchup started out as a general term for sauce, typically made of, uh, mushrooms or fish brine with herbs and spices. Some popular early main ingredients included blueberry, anchovy, oyster, kidney bean and grape.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No, that’s okay. I’ll get it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Listen, I was looking at the ring, and it seemed a little weird. No copyright notice on it. So, I took it down to this buddy of mine who deals with, shall we say, the seedy underbelly of the collectibles world.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Seedy underbelly?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You know, your black market phasers, your screen-worn Lieutenant Uhura panties, that kind of stuff.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Who’s this mysterious buddy you suddenly have?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Just a guy. I know a guy.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Is it Eddie Crispo?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No, I can’t tell you who it is. Stop asking.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Who else could it be? It has to be Eddie Crispo.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I know lots of dangerous people, okay?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Name one.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Eddie Crispo. Anyway, he said this isn’t a replica. It’s the real deal.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: If you’re suggesting that that is the actual ring of power forged by Sauron in Mount Doom, I look at you with an expression of exhaustion and ever so slight amusement.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: He’s not saying it’s a magic ring. You’re not, are you?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No, but it’s close. Look at the markings inside. Those are production markings. Nine rings were made for use in the Lord of the Rings movies. Three were given to members of the cast. The rest were destroyed. Except one. One was stolen. Gentlemen, this is the one ring.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (snatching it)
utterance.content: Mine!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, it is not yours. We all went in on the box together.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, yes, but I found it in the box, and the laws of maritime salvage clearly state that the finder of a sunken treasure is the owner of the treasure.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: How is this maritime salvage?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Other than the lack of water, how is it not?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Wait, wait. Sheldon, stop being crazy for a second. How much is something like this worth?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, it’s tough to say since it’s hot, but on the underground market, my guy figures…

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Your guy Eddie Crispo?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yes. He figures ten, maybe 15 thousand.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay, that’s a lot of money. The wise thing to do is invest it in something practical. Like a jet ski.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Why do you want a jet ski?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: All the wealthy and beautiful people in movies ride Jet Skis. That can’t just be a coincidence.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: We can’t sell it. We have to keep it and love it and polish it, and only take it out occasionally when we go to the park and re-enact our favourite scenes from the movies.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It’s sad how great that sounds.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Guys, it’s stolen. It should go back to Peter Jackson. He made the movies, it belongs to him.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Fine. He can have it back as long as he promises to make me a hobbit in his next movie.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: There are no Jewish hobbits.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Clearly, you’ve never been to my house for dinner on Rosh Hashanah.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: We are not blackmailing Peter J… All right, where’s the ring?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You mean my ring?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: The ring was unguarded, it was just sitting on the table, anyone could have taken it. Proof? I did.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Give me that.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Look, let’s be reasonable. We all want to do different things with the ring, but your ideas are stupid, and I want a jet ski.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I found it. The ring is mine. I don’t understand why in this group I never get my way.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You always get your way.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’ll stipulate to that if you give me the ring.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey, guys. Enjoying your food that I actually brought you instead of promising food, but bringing you a box of random crap?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, it’s delicious, the sarcasm’s a little stale, though. Hey, how about this? Until we figure out what to do with the ring, Penny holds on to it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What ring?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: This ring.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Looking for something?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Will you hold on to this for a couple of days?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s a prop from a movie, and we’re kind of fighting over it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, just to be clear, the first piece of jewellery my boyfriend gives me is a prop from a movie, and I don’t even get to keep it?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: If you had gone out with me three years ago, by now, you’d have my great Aunt Ida’s brooch that she smuggled out of occupied Belgium in a cat.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: How am I looking now?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Ow! You hit me! I’m bleeding!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What was that?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sheldon tried to take the ring and I punched him.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s my girl.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: So, Sheldon, how’s it feel to get beaten up by a girl?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s not the first time. I have a twin sister whose assaults began in utero. If only I’d had the presence of mind to reabsorb her, then I’d have a mole with hair in it instead of a tedious yearly Christmas letter.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Gentlemen, have you come to the realization that the only reasonable course of action is to sell the ring and divide the money?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I was afraid of that. Go ahead.

utterance.speaker: Man on Screen
utterance.content: Greetings from Mumbai. I am Raj’s attorney, Venkatesh Koothrappali.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Also my cousin.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You brought a lawyer?

utterance.speaker: Venkatesh
utterance.content: Don’t answer that. I’ll get straight to the point. My client’s prepared to surrender any interest he has in the ring in exchange for two Kawasaki Jet Skis.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: We’re not giving him two Jet Skis.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No Jet Skis.

utterance.speaker: Venkatesh
utterance.content: All right, forget the Jet Skis.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Forget the Jet Skis? That was our line in the sand! What happened to “tear them a new one?”

utterance.speaker: Venkatesh
utterance.content: What can I say? They played hardball. We lost.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You’re useless.

utterance.speaker: Venkatesh
utterance.content: I told you that when you hired me.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’m signing off now.

utterance.speaker: Venkatesh
utterance.content: Call your mother, she worries.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, just so you know, if we’re bringing in cousins who are lawyers, prepare for shock and awe.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You know what? I am ending this. Penny didn’t want to hold the ring anymore. She gave it to me, I have it. I’m sending it back. Where’s the ring?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You mean this ring? Next time be aware of your surroundings while urinating in a public men’s room.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Give me that.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, it’s mine.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It’s all of ours.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, now, this is ridiculous!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Then let go!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m not letting go, you let go.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I say this ring belongs to the last person who can hold on.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Fine. But can’t we go home and start this?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Sure. Let go of the ring.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: All right, it starts now.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You do realize there’s a giant bug movie marathon tonight on the Syfy Channel.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Wait, my laptop.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You know, there’s a point when this becomes idiotic.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: And it wasn’t when we were driving like this?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I would advise the three of you that resistance is futile. I have endless patience. I once spent two-and-a-half hours on hold with Hewlett-Packard customer service just to complain about their customer service.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You want to talk about endless patience? Penny made me watch all five seasons of Sex and the City.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: There are six seasons, dude.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, crap!

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No, no, no, the sixth season is great. We go to Paris with Carrie and get our heart broken, and then Mr. Big shows up, we don’t know if we can trust him again. It’s a wild ride.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Door.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay, everybody, and plie. And relevae.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Whatcha doin’?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Last one holding the ring decides its fate. I know, it sounds silly.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, no, no, no, no, no, you are my boyfriend. Nothing you do is silly to me.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: FYI, this is a bag from Victoria’s Secret.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m out.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m sorry, Ma, I have to stay late at the office.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No, he’s doesn’t! He’s lying to you!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Will you be quiet?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, if you want privacy let go of the ring. I’m so glad we came to this gentile strip club! Howard, here’s more bacon to tuck into the shiksa’s G-string!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’ll call you back.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I think it’s lovely you call your mommy and let her know you’re going to be late for dinner. From what I know about these things, if a woman doesn’t breast-feed on time, it’s very uncomfortable for her boobies.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Don’t you talk about my mother’s boobies!

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: If you’re offended, let go of the ring and go on home to your mother’s boobies.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Excellent, excellent. Tire each other out, the ring will be mine. Howard, why don’t you go after Raj’s mother?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Why don’t we go after your mother?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Go ahead. I have no illusions about my mother. She is a kind, loving, religiously fanatical right-wing Texan with a slightly out-of-scale head and a mild Dr. Pepper addiction. Anything you’d like to add?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That’s not gonna Better pull out the big gun.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You’re right. Let’s talk about your grandmother.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No! I call no Meemaws.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Think about this. The only way your mother was born was your Meemaw had sex.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I don’t want to hear this.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Then let go of the ring and walk away.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Never.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: All right. I’ll bet your Meemaw didn’t just have sex to have your mother. I bet she had sex because she liked it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Stop it!

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah, Meemaw did the nasty.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I said stop it!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: We’re getting to him.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Waterfalls!

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Waterfalls. Crashing waves. Babbling brooks.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Subliminal messaging. I’m going to make you want to pee. Dripping faucets. Leaky gutter. Peeing.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It’s, it’s not working, dude.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh-ho-ho, it’s working all right. I have to pee.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Then let go of the ring and go.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No, actually, I wouldn’t mind going, too.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Fine. Um, on the count of three. One, two…

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Wait, just to clarify. When you get to three, do we stand up or do we pee?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: We stand up.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Excellent choice.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Three.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Something tells me this was a bad day to wear suede shoes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’ve done it! I’ve won! The ring is mine! It’s mine! We’re going to clean it up and make it pretty. My own. My love. My precious. Where’s the ring?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s in a FedEx box on its way back to where it came from.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: The fires of Mount Doom?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Peter Jackson’s office in New Zealand. It wasn’t ours.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You quit the game! You had no right to take it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I came in here, you guys were all sleeping. The ring was on the floor. No one was touching it.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, so then we start the game over until there’s a winner.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: There wasn’t ever going to be a winner. There was going to be a selfish, petty person with a ring and three people who used to be his friend. Is that really what you guys want? ‘Cause if it is, fine, I don’t want anything to do with you. And I don’t know what happened in that bathroom, but I am not cleaning it up! My precious.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I knew it. Give us the precious!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: NEVER!

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Ugh, gotta go back to dating dumb guys from the gym.
